content: little josie scarf by dana fehrenbach this scarf is named after my maternal grandmother josephine treinen she was an amazing woman barely 5 feet tall who packed a ton of spunk grandma josie was an accomplished artist and talented seamstress who sold and serviced pfaff sewing machines i was lucky as a small child that she took me along to assist on service calls in clients homes as we made our rounds she taught me the ins and outs of sewing i am so blessed to have spent so much time with such an amazing lady my grandmother passed away as i was about to attend my junior prom wearing a beautiful lace and ruffle gunny sack design that my grandma josie helped me to construct it was our last project together i ve been flooded by so many fond memories of her as i knit this pattern i m so grateful for her i was honored by my own mother with the nickname little josie whenever i tinkered and fixed something for her be it a kitchen appliance an adding machine or whatever broke down in our farming household my mother would fondly say to me you are such a little josie little josie is constructed of a simple 2x2 ribbed cable pattern set off by a field of garter stitch wrap it loosely around your neck and let the tails hang long thinking of my amazing grandma josie and totally reversible all the grandmothers that we are so blessed totally fun to spend time with and learn from totally timeless like the moments spent with our grandmothers yarn finished dimensions baah yarns aspen 75% merino 15% silk and 10% 4 5 wide x 75 long after hard blocking cashmere 330 yards/100 grams gauge colorway bluenami 1 skein 32 sts = 4 in ribbed cable and garter st after needles blocking us 5 straights or short circulars gauge is not critical to this project but will affect notions finished size and drape and yarn quantity needed cable needle or spare double point 2 stitch markers not identical tapestry or darning needle for ends page 1 of 3 ©2023 dana fehrenbach danafehrenbachdesigns
